name: MITRE mapping of LockBit 3.0, also known as “LockBit Black,”

protocol (RDP) exploitation

EXECUTION AND INFECTION PROCESS: Enumerating system information such as hostname, host configuration, domain information,
local drive configuration, remote shares, and mounted external storage devices
INTIAL ACESS: Lockbit3.0 exploits public facing websites

services to exfiltrate data.

EXECUTION AND INFECTION PROCESS: LockBit 3.0 drops a ransom note with the new filename <Ransomware
ID>.README.txt and changes the host’s wallpaper and icons to LockBit 3.0 branding

EXECUTION AND INFECTION PROCESS
: Once completed, LockBit 3.0 may delete itself from the disk

EXECUTION AND INFECTION PROCESS: LockBit 3.0 will send encrypted host and bot information to a command and control (C2)
server

EXECUTION AND INFECTION PROCESS: LockBit 3.0 may also enable options for spreading via Group Policy Objects and
PsExec using the Server Message Block (SMB) protocol. LockBit 3.0 attempts to encrypt 
data saved to any local or remote device, but skips files associated with core system functions.

EXECUTION AND INFECTION PROCESS
: , LockBit 3.0 may delete itself from the disk  as well as any Group Policy
updates that were made
INTIAL ACCESS: drive-by compromise

INITIAL ACCESS:  LockBit 3.0 ransomware gain initial access to victim networks via remote desktop
protocol (RDP) exploitation
